result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (10th or More) and Operating w/ PAC (10th+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (10th or More) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (10th+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael J Vollrath was found guilty of OWI (10th or More), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentences currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or part-time if enrolled in school.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. 
Do not enter bars, taverns, liquor stores or places whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Do not have any contact with persons using alcohol or controlled substances. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Initially be supervised based on the DOC COMPAS assessment recommendations. 
Participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs deemed appropriate by supervision agent and follow through with recommendations.
Complete AODA or DOT Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentences currently being served.
This is to be installed the day the defendants driving privileges are reinstated.

/s/ TBE 02/03/16 - Motion denied without a hearing
for Substance Abuse Program Pursuant to Wis Stat 302.05
Sentencing Hearing held 7/24/14
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Michael J Vollrath in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Michael J Vollrath in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:24 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Cousins has no corrections or amendments to PSI.
Atty Raabe has no corrections or amendments to PSI.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Court asks the defendant if he would like to say anything on his behalf; defendant does not wish to speak.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
*10 years prison with 5 years of initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision
*Consecutive to any sentences currently being served
*No earned release program eligibility
*Pay fine of $3,214.00 (includes cost and dna surcharge)
*Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
*36 months IID on any vehicle owned or operated by the defendant; this is to be installed the day the defendant's driving privelege's are reinstated
*36 month DL revocation
*Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Do not enter bars, taverns, liquor stores or places whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
*Do not have any contact with persons using alcohol or controlled substances
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or part-time if enrolled in school.
*May use 25% of prison account to pay towards fine
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Initially be supervised based on the DOC COMPAS assessment recommendations.
*Participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs deemed appropriate by supervising agent and follow
through with recommendations. 

Count 2 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on July 24, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Vollrath in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Michael J Vollrath in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  10 yrs prison at 5 yrs Incarceration and 5 yr Extended Supervision, concecutive to any other sentence, PSI Report requested.  Defense would be free to argue.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Ct 1: OWI 10th: Guilty
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty ct 1 OWI 10th.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  Count 2 - PAC is dismissed.

BTC:
PSI Report is ordered
Parties to get Sentencing Hearing date from BR 1 JA.

Bond is revoked.

Atty Raabe states the Defendant objects to a PSI as he has had one in the past.
Court will still order a PSI report.

JA provided next court date in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
#1 - State Crime Laboratory Findings
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial in Circuit Court Branch 1.
